DataElement.preferredName: Charlson Comorbidity Index Diabetes Mellitus Severity Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the severity of diabetes mellitus using the Charlson Comorbity Index.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Charlson Comorbidity Index Diabetes Mellitus Severity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A method of predicting mortality risk or disease burden for patients with specific comorbid conditions. The conditions are assigned a weight from 1 to 6, based on ICD diagnosis codes, and these weights are summed to produce a single comorbidity score._A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization._Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A method of predicting mortality risk or disease burden for patients with specific comorbid conditions. The conditions are assigned a weight from 1 to 6, based on ICD diagnosis codes, and these weights are summed to produce a single comorbidity score.

Concepts.definition: A method of predicting mortality risk or disease burden for patients with specific comorbid conditions. The conditions are assigned a weight from 1 to 6, based on ICD diagnosis codes, and these weights are summed to produce a single comorbidity score.

Property.preferredDefinition: A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.

Concepts.definition: A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for 11/13/20 Princess Margaret CDE request. mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Irreparable damage to multiple organs/systems which is the result of chronic complications of diabetes.  The affected organs/systems include the cardiovascular system, kidneys, eyes, nervous system, joints and feet.

Concepts.definition: Irreparable damage to multiple organs/systems which is the result of chronic complications of diabetes.  The affected organs/systems include the cardiovascular system, kidneys, eyes, nervous system, joints and feet.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: The customary allowance of food and drink taken by a person or an animal from day to day, particularly one especially planned to meet specific requirements of the individual, including or excluding certain items of food; a prescribed course of eating and drinking in which the amount and kind of food, as well as the times at which it is to be taken, are regulated for therapeutic purposes or selected with reference to a particular state of health.: The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

The customary allowance of food and drink taken by a person or an animal from day to day, particularly one especially planned to meet specific requirements of the individual, including or excluding certain items of food; a prescribed course of eating and drinking in which the amount and kind of food, as well as the times at which it is to be taken, are regulated for therapeutic purposes or selected with reference to a particular state of health.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
